pr_title: Add aggregator factory check to determine if vectorized aggregators are supported for the inputs

timeline.message: All aggregators should use vectorization-aware column processor
All aggregators should use vectorization-aware column processor

timeline.bodyText: Setting this to TRUE to see if any other tests fail.
timeline.author: maytasm

replies.bodyText: Reverting to false since TimeseriesQueryRunnerTest.testTimeseriesWithTimestampResultFieldContextForArrayResponse is failing. Will look at it separately.
replies.author: maytasm

timeline.bodyText:
ColumnCapabilities#type is annotated as nullable. originalCapabilities.getType().isNumeric() could throw an NPE.
Same comment in Float and Long SumAggregatorFactories
timeline.author: suneet-s

replies.bodyText:
Btw I think ColumnCapabilities#type is never actually null. Segment metadata queries, which make sql work, do this to make the sql schema capabilities.getType().name().
Anyway, changed to ValueType.isNumeric(originalCapabilities.getType()) to be same and consistent with other places that use originalCapabilities.getType().
replies.author: maytasm

timeline.bodyText: Which tests validate these conditions? Similar comments for the other AggregatorFactories. I see DoubleMeanAggregator is being tested
timeline.author: suneet-s

replies.bodyText: SchemaEvolutionTest and DoubleMeanAggregationTest with Vectorize.TRUE triggers the bug case (where the column is not numeric and cannot be vectorized). I have made these tests run in both Vectorize.TRUE and Vectorize.FALSE mode to verify this fix. There are some other existing tests that are happy path (where the column is numeric and can be vectorized)
replies.author: maytasm

replies.bodyText:
👍
Just read SchemaEvolutionTest more closely, looks like it covers LongSum, DoubleSum and Count. I didn;t see a test that covers FloatSumAggregatorFactory
replies.author: suneet-s

timeline.bodyText: I really really (really really) think this needs a better name that doesn't include Provider, seeing that in a class name makes me expect this implements Provider<ColumnCapabilities> from com.google.inject.Provider. I'll try to think of some alternatives and get back to you on this.
timeline.author: clintropolis

+
+import javax.annotation.Nullable;
+
+public interface ColumnCapabilitiesProvider

replies.bodyText: How about ColumnDescriptions - segment columns are written to and loaded from a segment via a ColumnDescriptor which populates the ColumnCapabilities for segments, so it sort of makes sense I guess, and is generic enough to apply to things that aren't actual segments too. idk, naming things is the hardest part. AdapterCapabilities? Something with the word schema in it?
replies.author: clintropolis

replies.bodyText: ColumnInspector since it's sort of like VectorSizeInspector, a shared interface for a common pattern to collect information from things that aren't really exactly the same thing but all have the same information?
replies.author: clintropolis

   /**

timeline.bodyText: fieldName cannot be null for this one, there is a precondition in the constructor
timeline.author: clintropolis
